mlDocs.author: Bhikkhu Sujato

sn7.12:1.6.en: “This insatiable ascetic Gotama keeps coming back again and again!”

sn7.12:2.1.en: “Again and again, they sow the seed;

sn7.12:2.2.en: again and again, the king of the heavens sends rain;

sn7.12:2.3.en: again and again, farmers plough the field;

sn7.12:2.4.en: again and again, grain is produced for the nation.

sn7.12:3.1.en: Again and again, the beggars beg;

sn7.12:3.2.en: again and again, the donors give.

sn7.12:3.3.en: Again and again, when the donors have given,

sn7.12:3.4.en: again and again, they take their place in heaven.

sn7.12:4.1.en: Again and again, dairy farmers milk;

sn7.12:4.2.en: again and again, a calf cleaves to its mother;

sn7.12:4.3.en: again and again, oppressing and intimidating;

sn7.12:4.4.en: that dullard returns to the womb again and again.

sn7.12:5.1.en: Again and again, you’re reborn and die;

sn7.12:5.2.en: again and again, you get carried to a charnel ground.

sn7.12:5.4.en: one of vast wisdom is not reborn again and again.”

thag10.1:5.3.en: again and again, farmers plow the field;

thag10.1:5.4.en: again and again, grain is produced for the nation.

thag10.1:6.1.en: Again and again, the beggars wander,

thag10.1:6.2.en: again and again, the donors give.

thag10.1:6.3.en: Again and again, when the donors have given,

thag10.1:6.4.en: again and again, they take their place in heaven.

mlDocs.author: Bhikkhu Sujato

an10.23:1.3.pli: Atthi, bhikkhave, dhammā neva kāyena pahātabbā no vācāya, paññāya disvā pahātabbā.
an10.23:1.3.en: There are things that should be given up neither by the body, nor by speech, but by seeing again and again with wisdom.

an10.23:4.1.pli: Katame ca, bhikkhave, dhammā neva kāyena pahātabbā no vācāya, paññāya disvā pahātabbā?
an10.23:4.1.en: And what are the things that should be given up neither by the body, nor by speech, but by seeing again and again with wisdom?

an10.23:4.9.pli: macchariyaṁ, bhikkhave, neva kāyena pahātabbaṁ no vācāya, paññāya disvā pahātabbaṁ.
an10.23:4.9.en: and stinginess are things that should be given up neither by the body, nor by speech, but by seeing again and again with wisdom.

an10.23:5.1.pli: Pāpikā, bhikkhave, issā neva kāyena pahātabbā no vācāya, paññāya disvā pahātabbā.
an10.23:5.1.en: Nasty jealousy should be given up neither by the body, nor by speech, but by seeing again and again with wisdom.

an10.23:6.1.pli: Pāpikā, bhikkhave, icchā neva kāyena pahātabbā no vācāya, paññāya disvā pahātabbā.
an10.23:6.1.en: Corrupt wishes should be given up neither by the body, nor by speech, but by seeing again and again with wisdom.

an10.23:6.13.pli: Ime vuccanti, bhikkhave, dhammā neva kāyena pahātabbā no vācāya, paññāya disvā pahātabbā.
an10.23:6.13.en: Corrupt wishes should be given up neither by the body, nor by speech, but by seeing again and again with wisdom.

an10.69:5.1.pli: Imesañce tumhe, bhikkhave, dasannaṁ kathāvatthūnaṁ upādāyupādāya kathaṁ katheyyātha, imesampi candimasūriyānaṁ evaṁmahiddhikānaṁ evaṁmahānubhāvānaṁ tejasā tejaṁ pariyādiyeyyātha, ko pana vādo aññatitthiyānaṁ paribbājakānan”ti.
an10.69:5.1.en: Mendicants, if you bring up these topics of conversation again and again then your glory could surpass even the sun and moon, so mighty and powerful, let alone the wanderers of other religions.”

sn48.50:6.1.en: When a noble disciple has tried again and again, recollected again and again, entered immersion again and again, and understood with wisdom again and again, they will be confident of this:

mn12:62.9.pli: Te maṁ catunnaṁ satipaṭṭhānānaṁ upādāyupādāya pañhaṁ puccheyyuṁ, puṭṭho puṭṭho cāhaṁ tesaṁ byākareyyaṁ, byākatañca me byākatato dhāreyyuṁ, na ca maṁ dutiyakaṁ uttari paṭipuccheyyuṁ.
mn12:62.9.en: They’d bring up questions about the four kinds of mindfulness meditation again and again, and I would answer each question. They’d remember the answers and not ask the same question twice.
